tickets.description:
Dear friends,

I got installed the epic 0.6.13 on eclipse 3.3
and exported all my production modules/files on to location machine\(windows xp\)  which pefectly running without any warnings and errors having strict module usage.

But, when open these exported perl file/module file, got found strange with epic editor with following  -
1\. All validation errors highlights.
2\. Wrong link to line with error hight in problem view
3\. Meaningless Warnings with wrong link to a line in the code. In the Problem view, this warning link to some rand line in the code, seems. It never navigate to referred line either in the some file or link to any required module.
4\. Incorrect warning, though variable is being initialized in the parent module \(.pm\) and being used in the child perl module/file \(.pl\).


Most hightlighted errors are, though those are correct and perfectly working code. 

1\. Global Symbol issues.
2\. Missing right curly or square bracket
3\. syntax error at the end of all errors and that links to some commented line \(\#...\)
4\. Bareword found where operator expected, Scalar found where operator expected and linked to a line where open curly bracket of the method.
5\. Backslash found where operator expected

In detail -

1\. Global symbol "@arrStrConsistFileContent" requires explicit package name	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 303	1200679033362	3912
2\. Missing right curly or square bracket	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 567	1200679033127	3894

3\. syntax error	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 286	1200679033362	3913
4\. Backslash found where operator expected	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 131	1200679033940	3993

MeaningLess warnings -
1\. Backslash found where operator expected	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 131	1200679033940	3993
2\. Possible unintended interpolation of @arrStrConsistFileContent in string	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 303	1200679033408	3917
3\. Scalar found where operator expected	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 128	1200679033971	3996

4\. String found where operator expected	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	line 236	1200679033565	3941
5\. Use of uninitialized value in concatenation \(.\) or string in P:/nupworkspace/dev/bin/perl/NupCommonFunctions.pm line 52	dev/bin/perl	UpdateSharedConsist.pm	Unknown	1200687282455	5877

And observed that, Globabl varilable validation highlighting is on 
1\. if there is derived variable is in use at perl file by having declared in at module \(.pm\).
2\. if a variable is being declared and initialized at method level and used in the foreach loop though at same method level.


But, I wish see the atleast some nice working version, since, I love working with perl and got to see the excellent tool - EPIC. Excellent job.

Regards,
~S

What is the path to your Eclipse workspace?

If your workspace is /srv/www/cgi-bin/workspace \(which is my guess\), then it is definitely wrong to keep files in this directory. You should create a workspace elsewhere, e.e. under /home/user/workspace. Then you can create a Perl project and specify its location to be /srv/www/cgi-bin or /srv/www/cgi-bin/somewhere.

tickets.summary: Slow syntax highlighting when typing # comments
tickets.description: Commenting out a single line in a large file with \# causes an observable 1-2 seconds delay. Removing the comment does not suffer from this delay. The delay happens because the sync token sought by PerlPartitioner is wiped out by the comment action. Solution: look for a later sync token \(e.g., from the next line\) instead.

posts.author: nobody

It's not possible for unregistered users to submit a file for an existing bug.

I've double-checked the reason: the author of the sub-project left the project file encoding on ISO-8859-1 and committed the file with that encoding. After it \(don't ask me why and he left the company\) the sub-project's default encoding was changed into UTF-8. This causes the ISO-8859-1 umlauts to be displayed wrong - no problem.

But furthermore that causes EPIC to stop syntax highlighting after the first invalid umlaut.

When source folding is enabled \(in my case for Perldoc only\) then when I put the cursor under the folded area and hit Ctrl-Backspace -- an incorrect part of source is deleted -- several lines above the cursor.

tickets.summary: Editor crashes w/ Unhandled Event Loop Exception (java heap)
tickets.description:
This seems to crash the editor. I'm not sure why, but that's how I am able to reproduce it.

Open an EPIC editor.

Paste this:
foreach\(reverse s
\#my $login\_pass\_filter\_regex = qr\!\(\[^/\]\*?tps?://\)\(?:\[^/\]\*?\):\(?:\[^/\]\*\)\@\!;

The editor will freeze and crash with java heap error. From what I can see, it's some kind of an unlimited loop with memory leak. I'm using the latest testing version 0.6.22.

posts.author: archon810
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=2020727
Originator: YES

Actually, it seems only this is required for it to crash:

foreach\(reverse s
\#

If the hash is missing or there's anything else there, it doesn't crash. If there's anything that's not " s" after reverse, it doesn't crash. The combination of the 2 are the magic ingredients. /goes away confused.

tickets.summary: shift left works different than in other eclipse editors
tickets.description:
When you have a block of indented text, select it and execute "shift left" with Shift+Tab or Ctrl+Shift+Left, EPIC correctly moves the text to the left, removing one leading tab.

The problem occurs when there is one blank line in the text, without whitespace. "shift left" will not work in this case. Other eclipse editors do perform "shift left", removing one leading tab only where there is one in a line. So this means the text will be flattened, e.g.

first line
second line

will become

first line
second line

I find this very convenient as it is annoying if blank lines in an otherwise correctly indented text prevent me from using "shift left" in EPIC. This would be a very nice enhancement.

Thanks so much for EPIC, I use it every day.

posts.author: jploski
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=86907
Originator: NO

Fixed in CVS.

tickets.description:
I've recently installed Eclipse \(v3.5.1\) with the Epic plugin \(v0.6.35\) on a Fedora 12 Linux PC.  However, when I tried using the built-in "perldoc" feature it reports back "Documentation not found" error.  I've confirmed that "perldoc" is on my system path by running it from a terminal with the same user login.  I tried running eclipse as root and same issue.  I tried changing the Preferenes->Perl EPIC "Perl executable" from just "perl-T" to "/usr/bin/perl T" but got the same result.

Now when I start Eclipse from a terminal I noticied that it did NOT include the system path that is set by my login scrip \(.bash\_profile\) in the @INC path reported when it fails to find a module I have in perl script its loading from the perl project I'm currently working on.  I've attached this eclipse output in the eclipse\_start\_perdoc.txt file below.

The parser has some glitches like yours - and as you might know "only perl can parse perl".

Workaround: write

my $err = "Could not load configuration. Problem: " .
\(\($@\) ? $@ : "unknown"\) ."\n";

tickets.summary: normal code will be interpreted as regular expression
tickets.description: I use the latest version of EPIC \(0.6.11\) and have a problem with code formatting in editor. Many hashes in my code have keys like the following: "$hash->\{pReturn\}->\{mCustomerSet\}->\{mCustomerArray\}". The problem is that everything between the "mC" parts are interpreted as regular expression. If there are many lines of code between the first m\[A-Z\] and the next m\[A-Z\] it is not possible to read the code. I can´t change the names of keys because they are used later in xml structures.

tickets.summary: editor has problems recognising modules and code

tickets.description:
The "Word Wrap" editor option appears to be ON by default, and will not stay turned off.

Whenever a PERL script is opened, word warp mode is on.  If you look in Window -> Preferences, it show word wrap as OFF.  The only way to REALLY turn it off, though, is to click the checkbox \(so it appears to be ON\), click "Apply", click the checkbox again to turn it OFF, then click "Apply" or "OK".

However, if you close the window and re-open, word wrap mode is on again, even though if you check the preferences again, the checkbox is NOT checked.

1\) For a programming language, word wrap doesn't make much sense, but if it it's going to be there at all, it should default to OFF.

2\) If I explicitly set a preference, it should stick.

tickets.description:
Perl 5.10 introduced the "//" \(defined-or\) operator. EPIC treats it as two operators \(division, and the start of a match operator\). This results in syntax highlighting being "disabled" for huge swaths of code.

I hope this hasn't already been reported. My search didn't turn up anything, but there are so many syntax highlight tickets, 

Eclipse 3.6.2
EPIC 0.5.46
Perl 5.12.2

Thanks,
Eric

tickets.summary: TASK tagss should have the same format as in JDT or CDT
tickets.description:
We are using projects that contain C sources as well as Perl sources. We are using Task Tags to keep track of some work. However currently the task tags from Perl appear different than the JDT or CDT task tags and this makes it hard to format lists, automatically extract data and of course it just looks a little bit ugly.

Example:

\# TASK my task 
=> appears as "my task" in the task view.

// TASK my task
=> appears as "TASK my task" in the task view.


Basically both notations are of course legit, but the perl integration should use the same conventions as CDT or JDT if possible.

posts.author: samson_
posts.subject: #647 TASK tagss should have the same format as in JDT or CDT

posts.author: samson_
posts.text: @jploski - any opinion on that? We're explicitly stripping "TODO" at the beginning of a task comment, while others like JDT aren't. This also leads to funny results. e.g. if you put something like "TODO: be smart." it becomes ": be smart" in the task view.
posts.subject: #647 TASK tagss should have the same format as in JDT or CDT

tickets.description: The <enablement> tags specified in plugin.xml are ignored for the action in the Source menu, thus making it possible to run the PerlCriticAction without having provided a path to the perlcritic executable. In effect, the script to be checked is executed instead of perlcritic.

posts.author: jploski
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=86907
Originator: YES

Fixed in CVS.

After an unsuccessful attempt to control the menu action's enablement using the system property by overriding isEnabled, I decided to get rid of the optional enablement altogether. Instead:
1\. When the PerlCriticAction is run and Perl::Critic has not been enabled in Preferences, an appropriate message dialog is displayed. I think this is better than just showing the action in disabled state because it guides the user to do the right thing.
2\. PerlCriticAction will also check whether the provided path to the perlcritic script is correct \(or at least whether it points to an existing file\) and complain to the user if necessary.
posts.subject: #466 Problems with Perl::Critic's enablement

posts.author: jploski

tickets.description:
on EPIC 0.6.20, a line containing a '\#' in a regexp like the following:

next if \(/^\s\*$/ or /^\s\*\#/\);	\# skip comments

breaks subroutine folding and syntax highlighting, i.e. parts of the following subroutine are hidden as well when clicking on the "fold subroutine" button.
Obviously, this also breaks the subroutine listing in outline.

posts.author: jploski
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=86907
Originator: NO

Making sense of whether / is a slash or a division operator is tricky in general. As an easy workaround, you can use m/ instead of just / to indicate regex matching.

posts.text: - **status**: open --> closed-wont-fix

tickets.description:
I'd like to use the editor in text input mode. The syntax coloring is nice, but really all I want to do is have the system insert a brace where I type it, and tab over when I hit the tab.

I am always fighting with the tab and brace placement and there's apparently no way to turn this off\! 

In Preferences->Perl->Epic->Editor I've got all of "smart typing" turned off, "use spaces \(4\) instead of tabs", but still the following happens:

1\) Hit a newline and the system automatically tabs in
2\) Hit a close brace and the system automatically places the brace at the beginning of the line

For anyone who has to type in multiple editors on multiple types of documents and/or languages, they rapidly get into the habit of typing exactly what they want to see. Having the system automatically tab over or place the typed character somewhere where the user didn't want it continually fights with the user's sense of what's going on in the system.

I can understand that the perl monks among you would see this as a benefit, but can you please give us regular folks a way of turning it off?

I have files with both tabs and spaces for indent \(caused by working on them with other editors that seem to always compress runs of 8 leading spaces to a tab\). "Use spaces instead of tabs" is checked, "Displayed tab width" set to 8 and "Insert tabs/spaces on indent" set to 2.

Shifting works weird for lines that begin with tabs; shift left seems to always eat a tab, and shift right adds 2 spaces before the tabs.

Thanks.

posts.author: samson_
posts.text: - **status**: open --> closed-wont-fix
posts.subject: #520 "shift left/right", space indent and tabs

posts.author: samson_
posts.text:
I think you should first format your file consistently using the correct indention character. After that the ctrl+tab / ctrl+shift+tab can work without starting wild guessing on what to indentn / dedent. 

Beware that you need to close and reopen the editor when changing this setting.
posts.subject: #520 "shift left/right", space indent and tabs

tickets.description:
I am using this lengthy regexp in my app to parse config file lines:
if \(/^\s\*\(\[a-zA-Z\_\]+\[a-zA-Z\_0-9\]\*\(::\[a-zA-Z\_\]+\[a-zA-Z\_0-9:\]\*\)?\)\s\*=\s\*\('\(?:\[^\\\'\]|\\\\.\)\*'|"\(?:\[^\\\"\]|\\\\.\)\*"|\(?:\s\*\(?:\[^;\\\\\s\]|\\\\.\)+\)\*\)/\) \{
process\_line\(\)...
\}

It seems that all the subsequent text starting from 
'|"\(?:\[^ 
and after this regexp is having the same colour \(blue\) in editor. 
Also the outline does not show any subroutines after the regexp.

I am using Eclipse SDK, Version: 3.6.2
EPIC: 0.6.39

posts.author: jploski
posts.text: The code snippet you quoted doesn't cause syntax highlighting problems for me in 0.6.39.
posts.subject: #623 Regexp -> editor highlighting problem

posts.author: *anonymous
posts.text:
Hm, that's strange, please look at the screenshot at http://goo.gl/7Ex48 
and let me know if \(and how\) I can give you more debug info...
posts.subject: #623 Regexp -> editor highlighting problem

posts.author: *anonymous
posts.text:
Sorry for double post, here is the short script so you don't have to rewrite it from the picture...

http://pastebin.com/SxzTvEGv
posts.subject: #623 Regexp -> editor highlighting problem

posts.author: jploski
posts.text: The problem is two lines earlier, in the line with "unless". If you use m/.../ rather than just /.../ to give EPIC more clue, the highlighting problem will disappear.
posts.subject: #623 Regexp -> editor highlighting problem

posts.author: *anonymous
posts.text: You're right, thank you.
posts.subject: #623 Regexp -> editor highlighting problem

posts.author: dyakovi
posts.text:
Fails on split /\s+/, $line;, right after last / and until nearest +. 

Is fixed by adding m or using {} in the code. I'd say this is very serious problem: it can break both syntax highlight and code parsing. e.g. in my code the area of "confusion" (from / to nearest +) includes a subroutine declaration, so this subroutine is completely invisible to parser.
posts.subject: #644 syntax highlighting fails

posts.author: jploski
posts.text: Also fixed by using the syntax split(/\s+/, $line); which seems like a good idea anyway (make function parameter lists appear as such).
posts.subject: #644 syntax highlighting fails

posts.author: dyakovi
posts.text: ... which, of course, does not mean this EPIC bug does not need to be fixed. This bug severely depletes EPIC's usefulness for browsing through the code.
posts.subject: #644 syntax highlighting fails

posts.author: samson_
posts.text: Just tested with 0.7.0. The syntax highlighting looks good. Closing as fixed.
posts.subject: #644 syntax highlighting fails

tickets.description:
Every time an edit is made or a new file is opened the 
Perl exectable is opened in a DOS window and then 
immdiately closed.   Unfortunately, this window 
temporarily grabs focus so keystrokes are often lost to 
this newly opened when coding.   It would be preferable 
if this was run in the background so focus was kept in 
the editor.  I'm sure you can empathize with the 
frustrations this would cause.  

I'm running on Win2k

Eclipse Platform
Version: 2.1.0
Build id: 200303272130

Epic Plugin v0.1.0 \(downloaded this morning\)

posts.author: luelljoc
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=274815

This is a known java problem.

Here are the solutions given in the FAQ:
http://e-p-i-c.sourceforge.net/faq.html

1\. Using JDK 1.4 upward should fix the problem.
2\. If you are using ActiveState Perl use wperl.exe instead
of perl.exe in the EPIC preferences.
3\. If you want to use a different Perl interpreter \(e.g.
cygwin perl\) download launcher.zip unpack it \(e.g. to
c:\launcher\) and specify c:\launcher\launcher.exe in front
of the Perl Execuable in the EPIC preferences.

tickets.summary: "Properties" context menu should always be the last item
tickets.description:
Hi,

the perl plugin 0.4.13 adds a new context menu item
"Add perl nature". While the item is ok the position of
the item in the context menu is too prominent: this
item is used as last element in the context menu on
java projects \(which don't have a perl nature, and will
get none\). It would be nice if you would place the perl
item before the properties item \(or somewhere else\).
According to the Windows styleguide \(to which the
eclipse platform conforms\) should the last item of
every context menu be the properties item of the
selected element.

Best regards,

Ulli

tickets.description:
Subroutine detection for the Outline view fails if the
subroutine is defined on one line, and followed by a
semicolon, eg.

sub version \{ '$Id $' \};

Now, I agree that's not good code - the semi is not
needed.  \(And not something I'm likely to leave now
that it's been pointed out to me :\)  But it is \_valid\_
code according to Perl, so shouldn't break the EPIC parser.

posts.author: luelljoc
posts.text: - **assigned_to**: nobody --> luelljoc
posts.subject: #12 sub detection broken (slightly)

posts.author: lwadwell
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=963829

Another variation of this bug \(and more annoying, well at 
least for me\) is when an "optional" prototype is used in the 
subroutine declaration.
Same issue...there is a semicolon on the declaration line, but 
its more than a 'one liner'...eg

sub mySub \($$;$\) \{
...
\}

In this case, the semi is needed and it is good code.  Yes I 
can move the prototypes to the next line and everything is 
fine...except its not what I would call 'good style'.

tickets.description:
Pragmas are not modules, but outline show its as 
common modules.

Example:
\#=================================

use lib '/path/to/libs/'; \# Pragma \!
use strict; \# Pragma \!
use Data::Dumper; \# Module

\#=================================

posts.author: maiku41
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=766962

From the Camel \(Programming Perl. v III p 836\):

A pragma is a special kind of module...  pragmatic module....

Looks to me like it works as advertised.  However, as naming
conventions say \(only\) pragmas have names consting of only
lowercase letters, it shouldn't be too difficult to add a
flag to allow suppressing their display.

Want to give it a try?
posts.subject: #29 Pragmas are not modules

posts.author: maiku41
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=766962

Hmm... I see the current version supresses any module name
that \_begins\_ with a lower case letter.  This is not correct.

Camel III p.836:

When writing your own modules, use at least one capital
letter in the module name to avoid conflict with pragma names.

Perhaps that regex should be something like:

"^\[\\\s\]\*use\\\s+\(\[^a-z\]+\\\b\[^\\\n;\]+\)
posts.subject: #29 Pragmas are not modules

posts.author: luelljoc
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=274815

Could not get your regular expression working \(might be my fault\). 
Used this one instead: 
"^\[\\\s\]\*use\\\s+\(\[^\\\s\]\*\[A-Z\]+\[^;\\\s\\\n\]\*\)" 

Hope that's ok...
posts.subject: #29 Pragmas are not modules

tickets.description:
I have a perl script with valid POD info inside \(see below\). But the 
POD prevents the subroutines from being shown in the Outline.

The funny thing is: When I double the =cut line:

=cut
=cut

all subroutines are shown immediately. This doesn't even cause a 
perldoc warning, so I consider it as an okay workaround. But I 
don't wanna pollute my files with a stupid =cut\n=cut
Is there an easy fix in the epic sources?


\#\! /usr/bin/perl -w

=head1 NAME

Test 

=head1 METHODS

The following methods can be used:

=cut

\#\#\# Method test \#\#\#

=over 4

=item Test-&gt;test\(\);

Prints a test message 

=back

=cut

sub test \{
print &quot;test&quot;;
\}

\#\#\# Method test2 \#\#\#

=over 4

=item Test-&gt;test2\(\);

Prints a test message 

=back

=cut

sub test2 \{
print &quot;test2&quot;;
\}

1;

posts.author: mdreyer
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=831672

I found an interesting behavior:

if the number of =head1 headings is even \(as in the code example 
above\), the outline does not work. If it is odd, the outline works. So, just 
add 1, 3, or 5 , ..., methods, and the Outline works, i.e. methods are 
shown\!\!\! I hope there will be a fix soon\!

posts.author: jploski
posts.text:
This issue has been today reported again in the following forum thread: https://sourceforge.net/forum/message.php?msg\_id=7403257

The outline in EPIC up to 0.6.34 is sensitive against extra closing braces at the outermost level. If you add a closing brace after a subroutine belonging to a package, this will result in the outline becoming filled with "main" packages, each of which contains a single subroutine.

In Eclipse 3.4, after removing the superfluous closing brace, the outline might not return to the original correct content. When this happens, the following exception is logged, which may be due to a bug in Eclipse \(at least, this same exception has been reported for Aptana and Subclipse, and it doesn't seem to be easy to explain\):

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable \(org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed\)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error\(SWT.java:3777\)

at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench\(Workbench.java:488\)
at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench\(PlatformUI.java:149\)

at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke\(Method.java:597\)
at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework\(Main.java:549\)
at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun\(Main.java:504\)
at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run\(Main.java:1236\)
at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main\(Main.java:1212\)
Caused by: org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed

at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.getData\(Widget.java:472\)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.updateChildren\(AbstractTreeViewer.java:2609\)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.internalRefreshStruct\(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1856\)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.internalRefreshStruct\(TreeViewer.java:711\)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.internalRefresh\(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1831\)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.internalRefresh\(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1787\)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.internalRefresh\(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1773\)

As a countermeasure, I'm going to add two levels of fault tolerance - one against the extra closing braces at top level - the outline won't become messed up in the first place - and another against this particular exception \(repopulate outline from scratch when it is caught\).

tickets.summary: Regular Expressions in Hash-Values not marked correct
tickets.description:
Hello,

there seems to be a problem with regular expressions within hashes: The editor doesn´t recognize those expressions.

Example:
$hashthing = \{
\# some keys => some values,
regexp1   => m\{myregex\}xms,
regexp2   => qr\{\A \(?: a |b |c\) \z\}xms,
\};
\#some code
$a\_or\_b = $condition
? $a
: $b;

With this code \(I know it´s weird code ...\) the value of regexp1 isn´t marked as regular expression \(or as Literal1\).
The second regexp isn´t marked, too. but including the questionmark inside of it until the next questionmark is marked as literal1, too.

I am using EPIC 0.6.3, Eclipse 3.2.2 and Java 1.5.0\_10

posts.author: samson_
posts.text: We're gradually adding more exception logging in epic, so this one may be easier to investigate if we get some stacktrace or error log entry, alongside with more details and steps to reproduce it.
posts.subject: #639 Outline miss format

posts.author: abhishekisnot
posts.text: maybe since these pragmas should be displayed under separate category \(called Pragmata - padre does this.\).
posts.subject: #645 Lexical pragma imports

posts.author: jploski
posts.text:
You are technically right about the lexical scoping, but I suspect that most authors' intent is for these pragmas to be actually package-scope. When you write them right under "package" there is a background thinking going on that when the package is eventually migrated to a standalone file, these pragmas should come along with it.

Anyway, there is little benefit of displaying them under each package in the Outline, so if a change helps your development, feel free to submit a patch. Maybe they should not be displayed altogether? After all, you can disable warnings in a block and it is not displayed in the Outline in any way \(nor should it be, I think\).
posts.subject: #645 Lexical pragma imports

posts.author: samson_
posts.text:
At the moment it's kind of a half-baked solution. "use feature 'say'" does not show up at all, "use v5.20" shows up as "v5". If we hide them we need to keep a list of known pragmata. As you can also define your own pragma ( http://perldoc.perl.org/perlpragma.html ) this will be incomplete though, although 99% of the projects would not notice.

So, in general I would propose we keep pragma in, but we could improve the display in the outline..
posts.subject: #645 Lexical pragma imports

tickets.description:
How to reproduce:

After a bug has been closed you log into sourceforge.net as a regular user and add a comment to it.

Expected behaviour:

When adding the comment you can also reopen the bug.

Actual behaviour:

You can add the comment, but you cannot reopen the bug.  One week after adding the comment the bug is still closed.

Example:

bug \#1144462

posts.author: jploski
posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=86907
Originator: NO

I don't think I can influence this sf.net functionality \(I reopened the bug manually\). If you know a solution to let users reopen bugs, let me know. Otherwise, it would be a good idea to post a bug report against sf.net and request this functionality.
